qas.question: How many languages are used in the Congo?
What is the most populous ethnicity in the Congo?
How much of the population is constituted by Pygmies?
What percentage of the population of the Congo is Boulangui?
What country has a narrow range of languages?
How many languages are spoken outside of the Congo?
What amount of the Kongo are Laari?
What group lives on the Pacific coast?
How many groups can the Teke be categorized into?

context: Ethnically and linguistically the population of the <b4_0>Republic of the Congo<b4_0/> is diverse—Ethnologue recognises <a0_0><b5_0>62<b5_0/><a0_0/> spoken languages in the country—but can be grouped into <b8_0>three<b8_0/> categories. The <a1_0>Kongo<a1_0/> are the largest ethnic group and form <b6_0>roughly half<b6_0/> of the population. The most significant subgroups of the Kongo are Laari in Brazzaville and Pool regions and <b7_0>Vili<b7_0/> around Pointe-Noire and along the Atlantic coast. The second largest group are the Teke who live to the north of Brazzaville with 17% of the population. Boulangui (M’Boshi) live in the northwest and in Brazzaville and form <a3_0>1<a2_0>2%<a3_0/><a2_0/> of the population. Pygmies make up 2% of Congo's population.
